posts.cooked:
Hello FRC Community.

We saw that theres new releases for the limelight, however after installing all of them we ran into a problem. When opening BalenaEtcher and trying to select a target, both our limelight 2+ and 3 don’t seen to appear in BalenaEtcher. We’re connected to USB and all, but for some reason it just doesn’t appear.

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Have you tried a different cable? The one you have may be a charging only one.
Tried a different one, both times it didn’t appear.

posts.name: Alex Del
posts.cooked: Do you have all the correct drivers? I had the same issue and it was resolved when I downloaded the drivers necessary to write to the Limelight. It should be on the setup page on the documentation.
This is typically the issue, just ensure you have the drivers they indicate in the documentation.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: I recently had this problem, it’s a dumb problem. First, unplug your limelight from everything and then connect to it via USB C cable from your laptop. THEN, once the limelight has booted up (you can tell based one of its lights turning green) you launch Etcher.

posts.name: Dylan K
posts.cooked: If you have a 3G limelight you need to click the red button on the top and hold it while plugging in the USB c

posts.name: James Goebel
posts.cooked: I originally was using a Windows 11 Pro system and could not load the photonvision image file photonvision-v2025.3.1-linuxarm64_limelight2.img.xz for my limelight2 to upgrade it to the 2025 version. The load using Balenaetcher was Error(0,H.requestMetadata) is not a function. I tried multiple cables and different plug in procedures and Windows 11 would not work. I saw a thread to use Windows 10 and the USB driver download and Balenaetcher would load the file fine and the Limelight2 would be seen “compute module” and the download went fine. I had even tried the Raspberry Pi Imager. Thanks for the help!

suggested_topics.title: Error when running simulation WPILIB 2025.2.1
suggested_topics.excerpt: By selecting the jdk in \Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk in intellij, it worked. Thanks you everyone

accepted_answer.excerpt: I recently had this problem, it’s a dumb problem. First, unplug your limelight from everything and then connect to it via USB C cable from your laptop. THEN, once the limelight has booted up (you can tell based one of its lights turning green) you launch Etcher.
